# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the `wrap_string` function:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text, ' ')
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(current_line)+length(word)+1 > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
        current_line *= " " * word
    end
    push!(lines, current_line) # append the last line
    return join(lines, '\n')
end
```

Example:

```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet."
print(wrap_string(text))
```

This will wrap the input string to the specified text width. If a word is longer than `text_width`, it will be placed on its own line.
